revised_title: Decidua's Role in Early Gestation and Circulation of Maternal Blood
tldr: Robert Lee's study on the anatomy and physiology of the decidua reveals its role in the circulation of maternal blood during early gestation. He observes that the veins of the uterine decidua convey blood from the deciduial cavity into the veins of the uterus, suggesting a constant flow of maternal blood from the chorion cells through the decidua reflexa into the deciduial cavity.
